channel.title: Relatively Easy Question
channel.description: Alright here's the question: How remove an NPC's ability to walk? And also follow. I want to make a monster thats aggressive, and attacks you when u run by with lets say wind wave but doesn't chase you or walk up to you, it only stays in it's spawn spot. I've seen other servers with the corp beast(aggressive) where the beast doesn't move/chase/run up to you, but it will face you and attack anyone in its lair with mage. My server is a 317 if that helps. THANKS!..

item.title: Relatively Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

That will just fuck up your autospawn, it’s in npchandler, as the title says it handles npc’s.

Read full topic

item.title: Relatively Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @hitman2009 hitman2009
item.description:
@hitman2009 wrote:

r34p4g3pk:

Then you would set it so when you leave certain coordinates it will stop chasing you. I believe it’s somewhere around npchandler. Take a look at the codes.

in autospawn, i wonder if i delete the 0’s and the last 1 that it wouldnt be able to move?
2693 9564 0 0 0 0 0 1

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Then you would set it so when you leave certain coordinates it will stop chasing you. I believe it’s somewhere around npchandler. Take a look at the codes.

item.title: Relatively Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @hitman2009 hitman2009
item.description:
@hitman2009 wrote:

r34p4g3pk:

Take out the walking coordinates, which would be in the auto spawn, it’s in the line of code beside where your npc is programmed to stay (Stand still). Also, to make an npc aggressive, go into npchandler class, and search public boolean npcGetsAnnoyed(int Npc) { Add an npc case which the others, for example (case 500:) so the 500 is the npc id, this makes the monster attack you when you go near it’s coordinates.

ik how to make it aggressive, and if i set the coords after the npc’s spawn spot to 0, then if i attack it, it follows/chases me

Read full topic

item.title: Relatively Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @r34p4g3pk r34p4g3pk
item.description:
@r34p4g3pk wrote:

Take out the walking coordinates, which would be in the auto spawn, it’s in the line of code beside where your npc is programmed to stay (Stand still). Also, to make an npc aggressive, go into npchandler class, and search public boolean npcGetsAnnoyed(int Npc) { Add an npc case which the others, for example (case 500:) so the 500 is the npc id, this makes the monster attack you when you go near it’s coordinates.

Read full topic
